duty.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant owned/controlled the ladder stored adjacent to Plaintiff’s parking area and pleads the general duty to exercise reasonable care in storage/securing of hazardous items (¶¶5-6,16). Those factual allegations reasonably establish a duty to avoid foreseeable harm to users of the shared driveway.

breach.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant habitually stored the unsecured ladder, received repeated warnings from Plaintiff, acknowledged the problem, promised to secure or move it, but failed to do so (¶¶7-9,17), which sufficiently pleads a breach of the asserted duty.

causation_but_for.reasoning: Complaint alleges that because the ladder was unsecured it was blown by a gust of wind and fell onto Plaintiff’s vehicle (¶¶9,10,18). Those facts support a but‑for nexus: but for the ladder being left unsecured by Defendant, it would not have fallen onto the vehicle.

causation_proximate.reasoning: Complaint pleads that Plaintiff warned Defendant the ladder could fall in windy conditions and that Defendant failed to secure it (¶¶7-8,17), establishing that harm of a falling ladder in wind was foreseeable and that the damage was a proximate result of Defendant’s conduct (¶¶9,11,18).

damages.reasoning: Complaint alleges concrete property damage (dented hood, cracked windshield) and out‑of‑pocket economic losses (repair/replacement costs, insurance deductible, rental car costs) and seeks compensatory relief (¶¶10-12,19; Prayer A).
